item.title: 0.13.0 Binary Safety Warning
item.description:
0.13.0 Binary Safety Warning

We strongly recommend that you download that key, which should have a fingerprint of 01EA5486DE18A882D4C2684590C8019E36C2E964. You should securely verify the signature and hashes before running any Bitcoin Core binaries. This is the safest and most secure way of being confident that the binaries you're running are the same ones created by the Core Developers.

item.title: Bitcoin Classic 1.1.0 Safety warning! High Priority! * /r/btc
item.description:
Bitcoin Classic 1.1.0 Safety warning! High Priority! * /r/btc

We have reason to suspect that the current binaries for Bitcoin Classic will likely be targeted by Xenu the Dictator of the Galactic...

item.title: ELI49: Why is one single person able to change the bitcoin.org website and NOBODY ELSE even knows what tf this is all about? * /r/Bitcoin
item.description:
ELI49: Why is one single person able to change the bitcoin.org website and NOBODY ELSE even knows what tf this is all about? * /r/Bitcoin

EDIT: To be clear: I'm not worried because one person did it, I'm worried because NOBODY ELSE seemed to know about it.

item.title: New Snowden documents confirm leaked NSA tools are real
item.description:
New Snowden documents confirm leaked NSA tools are real

Newly released documents from the Edward Snowden archive, published today by The Intercept , confirm what was already suspected this week: some of the NSA's secret malware is out in the open. 16-character string matches up On Saturday, a group going by the name "the Shadow Brokers" began leaking what it said were NSA exploits and scripts.

item.title: The Wretched, Endless Cycle of Bitcoin Hacks
item.description:
The Wretched, Endless Cycle of Bitcoin Hacks

It seemed bitcoin exchange Bitfinex was doing all the right things. In the end, that didn't stop hackers from stealing $65 million. The latest in a long list of attacks on the digital currency since its birth in 2009 has been particularly vexing for the bitcoin community.

item.title: The Bitcoin Podcast: TBP80 - A Means to an End
item.description:
The Bitcoin Podcast: TBP80 - A Means to an End

Part 2 of the Steven McKie character piece is concluded. In addition, this episode we are talking with Max Kordek, the founder of a new decentralized platform called Lisk. Since the launch of Lisk there was a lot of confusion about what it really is, and what it enables people to do in the future.
